required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Twynsta Study With Lifestyle Modifications in Korean Patients With Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: An Observational Study to Evaluate the Effects of Twynsta Tablets (Telmisartan and Amlodipine FDC, q.d.) With Life Style Modifications on Blood Pressure, Quality of Life, and Other Risk Factors in Korean Patients With Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study is designed to evaluate the effects of Twynsta tablets with life style modifications on blood pressure, quality of life, and other risk factors in Korean patients with hypertension in a routine clinical practice setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Blood Pressure Change Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) From Baseline After 24±2 Weeks of Treatment or at the Last Observation in Case of Early Withdrawal.
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint is the mean blood pressure change SBP from baseline after 24±2 weeks of treatment or at the last observation in case of early withdrawal. Baseline is defined as data collected on baseline visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Blood Pressure Change Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) From Baseline After 24±2 Weeks of Treatment or at the Last Observation in Case of Early Withdrawal.
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint is the mean blood pressure change DBP from baseline after 24±2 weeks of treatment or at the last observation in case of early withdrawal. Baseline is defined as data collected on baseline visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving Target Blood Pressure SBP/DBP <140/90 mmHg.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving target blood pressure SBP/DBP <140/90 mmHg is a key secondary endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving DBP Response
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving DBP response (defined as mean seated DBP < 90 mmHg or a drop of ≥ 10 mmHg) is a key secondary endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving SBP Response
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving SBP response (defined as mean seated SBP < 140 mmHg or a drop of ≥ 10 mmHg) is a key secondary endpoint.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline of Quality of Life Assessment Data Measured by World Health Organization Quality of Life (WHOQOL-BREF)- Physical Health Domain
secondary_outcome.description: WHOQOL-BREF, an abbreviated 26 item version of the WHOQOL-100 was developed to enable a brief but accurate assessment of the quality of life. The Korean version of WHOQOL-BREF is valid and reliable in the assessment of quality of life in Koreans. The WHOQOL-BREF is based on the four domain structure (physical health, psychological, social relationships, and environment). It was designed to use 5-point scales for all questions (not at all, a little, moderately, mostly, and completely). The scale goes from 4 to 20 in each domain structure and 0 to 5 in overall score, a low value shows better physical health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline of Quality of Life Assessment Data Measured by World Health Organization Quality of Life (WHOQOL-BREF)- Psychological Domain
secondary_outcome.description: WHOQOL-BREF, an abbreviated 26 item version of the WHOQOL-100 was developed to enable a brief but accurate assessment of the quality of life. The Korean version of WHOQOL-BREF is valid and reliable in the assessment of quality of life in Koreans. The WHOQOL-BREF is based on the four domain structure (physical health, psychological, social relationships, and environment). It was designed to use 5-point scales for all questions (not at all, a little, moderately, mostly, and completely). The scale goes from 4 to 20 in each domain structure and 0 to 5 in overall score, a low value shows better physical health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline of Quality of Life Assessment Data Measured by World Health Organization Quality of Life (WHOQOL-BREF)- Social Relationships Domain
secondary_outcome.description: WHOQOL-BREF, an abbreviated 26 item version of the WHOQOL-100 was developed to enable a brief but accurate assessment of the quality of life. The Korean version of WHOQOL-BREF is valid and reliable in the assessment of quality of life in Koreans. The WHOQOL-BREF is based on the four domain structure (physical health, psychological, social relationships, and environment). It was designed to use 5-point scales for all questions (not at all, a little, moderately, mostly, and completely). The scale goes from 4 to 20 in each domain structure and 0 to 5 in overall score, a low value shows better physical health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline of Quality of Life Assessment Data Measured by World Health Organization Quality of Life (WHOQOL-BREF)- Environment Domain
secondary_outcome.description: WHOQOL-BREF, an abbreviated 26 item version of the WHOQOL-100 was developed to enable a brief but accurate assessment of the quality of life. The Korean version of WHOQOL-BREF is valid and reliable in the assessment of quality of life in Koreans. The WHOQOL-BREF is based on the four domain structure (physical health, psychological, social relationships, and environment). It was designed to use 5-point scales for all questions (not at all, a little, moderately, mostly, and completely). The scale goes from 4 to 20 in each domain structure and 0 to 5 in overall score, a low value shows better physical health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline of Quality of Life Assessment Data Measured by World Health Organization Quality of Life (WHOQOL-BREF)- Overall
secondary_outcome.description: WHOQOL-BREF, an abbreviated 26 item version of the WHOQOL-100 was developed to enable a brief but accurate assessment of the quality of life. The Korean version of WHOQOL-BREF is valid and reliable in the assessment of quality of life in Koreans. The WHOQOL-BREF is based on the four domain structure (physical health, psychological, social relationships, and environment). It was designed to use 5-point scales for all questions (not at all, a little, moderately, mostly, and completely). The scale goes from 4 to 20 in each domain structure and 0 to 5 in overall score, a low value shows better physical health.

The EQ VAS records the respondent's self-rated health on a vertical, visual analogue scale where the endpoints are labelled 'best imaginable health state' and 'worst imaginable health state. The scale goes from 0 to 100, a low value shows better physical health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving SBP/DBP < 130/80 mmHg Among Patients With Diabetes or Kidney Disease
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving SBP/DBP < 130/80 mmHg among patients with diabetes or kidney disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Blood Lipid Change - Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL)-Cholesterol
secondary_outcome.description: Mean blood lipid change from baseline - low density lipoprotein (LDL)-Cholesterol

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Blood Lipid Change - High Density Lipoprotein (HDL)-Cholesterol
secondary_outcome.description: Mean blood lipid change from baseline - high density lipoprotein (HDL)-Cholesterol

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Blood Lipid Change - Total Cholesterol
secondary_outcome.description: Mean blood lipid change - Total Cholesterol

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving Normal Body Mass Index (BMI)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving normal BMI (18.5 kg/sq.m to 24.9 kg/sq.m) are presented

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Complied With Each Category of Lifestyle Modification Recommendations at 12±2 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who complied with each category of lifestyle modification recommendations at 12±2 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Complied With Each Category of Lifestyle Modification Recommendations at 24±2 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who complied with each category of lifestyle modification recommendations at 12±2 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and Severity of Reported Adverse Events.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence as per the severity of reported adverse events is presented.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Patients with essential hypertension whose blood pressure is not adequately controlled by amlodipine or telmisartan monotherapy (=140/90 mmHg, = 130/80 mmHg for those with diabetes or kidney disease)
2. Age = 19 years at enrollment
3. Male or female patient (or legally acceptable representative) willing and able to provide written informed consent
Exclusion criteria:
1. Patients with previous exposure to Twynsta
2. Patients with hypersensitivity to the active substances, or to dihydropyridine derivatives
3. Female patients at second and third trimesters of pregnancy
4. Female patients with lactation
5. Patients with biliary obstructive disorders
6. Patients with severe hepatic impairment
7. Patients with high grade aortic stenosis
8. Patients with shock
9. Patients with hereditary conditions such as intolerance with excipient of the products
10. Current participation in other clinical trials or observational studies

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This is an observational study to evaluate the effects of Twynsta tablets (Telmisartan and amlodipine fixed dose combination (FDC), once daily (q.d.)) with life style modifications on blood pressure, quality of life, and other risk factors in Korean patients with hypertension

group.title: Twynsta (Telmisartan and Amlodipine FDC) Tablets
group.description: Oral administration of Twynsta (Telmisartan and amlodipine FDC) tablets. The doses of telmisartan are 40 mg and 80 mg combined with either 5 mg or 10 mg of amlodipine. The dose combinations for telmisartan/amlodipine in the study are as follows: 40 mg/5 mg, 40 mg/10 mg and 80 mg/5 mg.

baseline.population: All treated patients fulfilling the inclusion-exclusion criterias and who have completed the follow-up visits of the study.

group.title: Twynsta (Telmisartan and Amlodipine FDC) Tablets
group.description: Oral administration of Twynsta (Telmisartan and amlodipine FDC) tablets. The doses of telmisartan are 40 mg and 80 mg combined with either 5 mg or 10 mg of amlodipine. The dose combinations for telmisartan/amlodipine in the study are as follows: 40 mg/5 mg, 40 mg/10 mg and 80 mg/5 mg.

outcome.description: The primary endpoint is the mean blood pressure change SBP from baseline after 24±2 weeks of treatment or at the last observation in case of early withdrawal. Baseline is defined as data collected on baseline visit.
outcome.population: All patients with a baseline and an endpoint blood pressure measurement.

measure.description: The primary endpoint is the mean blood pressure change SBP from baseline after 24±2 weeks of treatment or at the last observation in case of early withdrawal. Baseline is defined as data collected on baseline visit.
measure.population: All patients with a baseline and an endpoint blood pressure measurement.

analysis.p_value_desc: Mean SBP change from baseline at the last visit will be analyzed by paired t-test

outcome.title: Change From Baseline of Quality of Life Assessment Data Measured by World Health Organization Quality of Life (WHOQOL-BREF)- Physical Health Domain
outcome.description: WHOQOL-BREF, an abbreviated 26 item version of the WHOQOL-100 was developed to enable a brief but accurate assessment of the quality of life. The Korean version of WHOQOL-BREF is valid and reliable in the assessment of quality of life in Koreans. The WHOQOL-BREF is based on the four domain structure (physical health, psychological, social relationships, and environment). It was designed to use 5-point scales for all questions (not at all, a little, moderately, mostly, and completely). The scale goes from 4 to 20 in each domain structure and 0 to 5 in overall score, a low value shows better physical health.
outcome.population: Patients with a baseline and an endpoint WHOQOL-BREF response

group.title: Twynsta (Telmisartan and Amlodipine FDC) Tablets
group.description: Oral administration of Twynsta (Telmisartan and amlodipine FDC) tablets. The doses of telmisartan are 40 mg and 80 mg combined with either 5 mg or 10 mg of amlodipine. The dose combinations for telmisartan/amlodipine in the study are as follows: 40 mg/5 mg, 40 mg/10 mg and 80 mg/5 mg.

measure.title: Change From Baseline of Quality of Life Assessment Data Measured by World Health Organization Quality of Life (WHOQOL-BREF)- Physical Health Domain
measure.description: WHOQOL-BREF, an abbreviated 26 item version of the WHOQOL-100 was developed to enable a brief but accurate assessment of the quality of life. The Korean version of WHOQOL-BREF is valid and reliable in the assessment of quality of life in Koreans. The WHOQOL-BREF is based on the four domain structure (physical health, psychological, social relationships, and environment). It was designed to use 5-point scales for all questions (not at all, a little, moderately, mostly, and completely). The scale goes from 4 to 20 in each domain structure and 0 to 5 in overall score, a low value shows better physical health.
measure.population: Patients with a baseline and an endpoint WHOQOL-BREF response

analysis.p_value_desc: The change of QOL data collected using the WHOQOL-BREF is analyzed by paired t-test

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Achieving SBP/DBP < 130/80 mmHg Among Patients With Diabetes or Kidney Disease
outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving SBP/DBP < 130/80 mmHg among patients with diabetes or kidney disease
outcome.population: All patients with diabetes, kidney disease or both (diabetes + kidney disease)

outcome.description: Mean blood lipid change from baseline - low density lipoprotein (LDL)-Cholesterol
outcome.population: Patients with medical history of hyperlipidemia and who have a baseline and an endpoint lipid profile measurement together with evaluation record on recommendations for lifestyle modifications.

analysis.p_value_desc: Mean LDL-C change from baseline at the last visit will be analyzed by paired t-test

outcome.population: Patients with medical history of hyperlipidemia and who have a baseline and an endpoint lipid profile measurement together with evaluation record on recommendations for lifestyle modifications.

group.title: Twynsta (Telmisartan and Amlodipine FDC) Tablets
group.description: Oral administration of Twynsta (Telmisartan and amlodipine FDC) tablets. The doses of telmisartan are 40 mg and 80 mg combined with either 5 mg or 10 mg of amlodipine. The dose combinations for telmisartan/amlodipine in the study are as follows: 40 mg/5 mg, 40 mg/10 mg and 80 mg/5 mg.

measure.title: Mean Blood Lipid Change - Triglyceride
measure.description: Mean blood lipid change - Triglyceride
measure.population: Patients with medical history of hyperlipidemia and who have a baseline and an endpoint lipid profile measurement together with evaluation record on recommendations for lifestyle modifications.

analysis.p_value_desc: Mean Triglyceride change from baseline at the last visit will be analyzed by paired t-test

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI's intellectual property rights.
